cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 35 mi SSW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then accelerating north-northeast across the east-central Gulf toward Florida’s Big Bend/Tampa Bay region
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near/just north of Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: Chokoloskee northward to Englewood, FL and from mouth of St. Mary’s River to South Santee River, SC (storm-surge & tropical-storm watches)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Middle of Longboat Key northward to Indian Pass, including Tampa Bay (Hurricane & Storm Surge Warnings)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from Englewood through Tampa Bay and Big Bend to Indian Pass
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely Tuesday afternoon with a 42% chance of sustained 50-kt winds; hurricane-force gusts possible Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–7 ft of inundation possible in Tampa Bay, including Port Manatee.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with locally up to 12 inches; flash and urban flooding possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Risk of tornadoes beginning Tuesday, dangerous surf and rip currents impacting port approaches.
